title: (x) Association Football Club - (similar to) Goodfellow/Kildare {Type}
content:
Hi everyone,   
   
Does anyone here recognize this typeface? It was used by a sports team in the late 1890's in England, and I'm trying to find its modern-day equivalent. Take a look at those 'A's and 'S's. Pretty distinctive, don't you think?   
   
Any ideas would be greatly appreciated!   
   
Many thanks for your time,   
   
Andrew   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49960.jpg)   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49961.jpg)   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49962.jpg)
author: ajgray

comments.content: There's also [Downtown Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aboutype/downtown/), which is more narrow and rounded like the sample, but is obliqued. You may be able to skew it back, but that's pretty dicey.
Oh, and Type: be a sport and provide links, wouldja? I know you're all impressive and everything, but that's how we nonimpressive folks do things around here...

_Oh, and Type: be a sport and provide links, wouldja? I know you're all impressive and everything, but that's how we nonimpressive folks do things around here..._   
   
   
1. i didn't/don't have a link.   
2. if i'm going to have/know - i'd love to post it.   
3. i searched myfonts.com, but i didn;t find it (and that is why i wrote solotype)   
4. get over the trajan thread . move on.
Oh, all right. Sorry, Type -- I was looking for a fight, and you were the most likely candidate. I was out of line.

_I was looking for a fight, and you were the most likely candidate_   
   
ok. i'm ready ![a](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/50002.jpg)

Inexplicably the link for Ravenscroft which worked fine earlier seems to have shut down... [here's](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223/http:/www.fontseek.com/cgi-bin/fsearch.pl?search=ravenscroft) another.   
   
Besides being free, the font contains alternate characters for the R, A, N among others. It seems to have been created by/for Disney's Haunted Mansion.   
   
and while we're on the subject of links, am I the only one who vastly prefers when they open up in new windows?   
   
A note to Type: the links exist (often) if you look for them. I found [Goodfellow](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/goodfellow/) very easily. Google works too.
Not at all... I totally appreciate links opening in new windows....

oh, boys and girls. you really don't know what is respect?   
   
1. my post was: **Goodfellow (solotype) ? or Kildare**   
   
2. why "Goodfellow" with **"?"** - since of the uc "L".   
   
3. if you're going to search (myfonts.com) for Kildare, you're going to find "Karp" (a type designer that worked for/with Apple)   
 ![2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/50018.jpg)
Hey, speaking of respect how come I got no credit for coming up with a FREE match for the sample, legal and all (courtesy of Disney of all places).
Well OK then... service WITHOUT attitude is my motto.
